textArr:
The Waterfalls of Pahang is a large State, taking up a large portion of the Peninsula, and sparsely populated. 
This is a state with high hills, tall mountains and large alluvial plains, a natural place for waterfalls.
A few of these waterfalls are within easy reach, for most of them some effort is needed
   
   


	   Accessability: Easy
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Bertangga FallNorth of Lake Bera
	  RapidsSingle fall
	  Picnic
	  A small but attractive waterfall, hidden deep in the hills of Central Pahang
Last update August 2009
	 
	  
	  Chamang FallNear Bentong
	  RapidsSingle fall
	  PicnicSwimming
	  A powerful waterfall.
Be aware of strong currents. Accidents have happened here.Last update July 2004
	 
	  
	  Jeriau FallFrasers Hill
	  RapidsSingle fall
	  PicnicSwimming
	  In a very landscaped park the nice waterfall comes as a surprise. Pool more suitable for wading than for swimmingLast update July 2004
	 
	  
	  Lata JarumNorth of Raub at Kg Ulu Dong
	  Cascades
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Popular weekend destination

Last update February 2007
	 
	  
	  Lata Lembik40 km North West of Raub
	  Rapids
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Not a waterfall. Some rapids, suitable for white water raftingLast update April 2005
	 
	  
	  Lata MeraungNear Jerantut
	  CascadesSingle fall
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Small, but very scenic waterfall  Last update April 2008
	 
	  
	  LentangOff the KL-Karak highway
	  RapidsCascades
	  PicnicSwimmingCamping
	  Attractive Hutan Lipur with some rapids and cascadesLast update December 2005
	 
	  
	  Pandan FallOn the road from Kuantan to Panching
	  Single fall
	  PicnicSwimmingCamping
	  The waterfall is impressive, tall, broad and near vertical drop. Water volume depends on the season.Last update May 2007
	 
	  
	  Parit FallCameron Highlands, Tanah Rata
	  Single fall
	  PicnicTrekking
	  Small, attractive fall, but quite pollutedLast update October 2006
	 
	  
	  Robinson FallsCameron Highlands, Tanah Rata
	  CascadesSingle fall
	  Trekking
	  Nice waterfall on walking distance of the village

Last update August 2006
	 
	  
	  Sg Dua falls (Lata Khong)Near Kg Sg Dua
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingCamping
	  Unknown, beautiful series of waterfalls, not far from Karak. The lower tier is also known as Lata KhongLast update January 2010
	 
	  
	  Sri Mahkota FallEndau Rompin National Park
	  Single fall
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Remote waterfall in the Pahang section of Endau Rompin.Last update August 2009
	 
	  
	  Teladas FallsNear Maran
	  Multiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingCamping
	  The waterfalls have known better times. Very murky water
	 
	   Accessability: Moderate
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Berkelah FallsBetween Maran and Kuantan
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Beautiful series of waterfalls and cascades in the Berkelah river.Last update December 2003
	 
	  
	  Gapoi FallNear Gapoi, on the road from Karak to Simpang  Pertang
	  Single fall
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Not often you will find such a large fall near to an inhabited area, ideal for picnic and swimmingLast update April 2005
	 
	  
	  Genuai FallNear Kuala Krau
	  CascadesSingle fall
	  Trekking
	  A rather tall near vertical fall in rocky surroundingsLast update March 2022
	 
	  
	  Jerangkang fallsKamping Paya Bungor
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Spectacular series of waterfalls. Similar to Berkelah, but even more impressive.Last update July 2004
	 
	  
	  Lata Tampitnear Janda Baik
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  Charming 7-tier waterfalls near Janda BaikLast update March 2010
	 
	  
	  Lata Woh FallsBetween Karak & Mentakab
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  Multi-level falls with pools, can be seasonal.Last update March 2022
	 
	  
	  Perting FallOff the Gombak-Bentong road
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Beautiful, unspoilt waterfall.
Descending to the fall from the path is not easy.
Also known as Lata HammersLast update July 2006
	 
	  
	  Rainbow FallNear Sungei Lembing
	  Single fall
	  Swimming
	  The famous rainbow is best seen in the morning

Last update September 2008
	 
	  
	  Seminyang Fall12 km from Karak, on the road to Kuala Pilah
	  Single fall
	  Trekking
	  A powerful waterfall on the Pahang side of the Gunung Hantu BesarLast update November 2010
	 
	  
	  Tanglir FallsNear Bukit Tinggi, Genting Highlands
	  Multiple falls
	  Swimming
	  One of the most spectacular falls near Kuala LumpurLast update April 2003
	 
	  
	  Terapai Fall30 km south of Tasek Chini
	  Single fall
	  Swimming
	  Deep within the hills of Southern Pahang. Romantic setting.
Last update August 2009
	 
	   Accessability: Difficult
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Air Terjun Harimau Berjemur100 km north of Segamat
	  CascadesSingle fall
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Remote fall, long 4WD access. Trekking easyLast update February 2012
	 
	  
	  Berembun Fall13 km from Kg Klau on the slopes of G. Benom
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  This powerful fall can only be reached with a 4WD
Last update March 2003
	 
	  
	  Cemperoh FallJanda Baik
	  Single fall
	  SwimmingTrekking
	  Nice waterfall, hidden in the jungleLast update August 2005
	 
	  
	  Kenip FallEast of Sungei Koyan, north of Raub
	  Single fall
	  SwimmingTrekking
	  Remote fall in Orang Asli country. Guide neededLast update August 2006
	 
	  
	  Lata NyangungSouth of Karak on the road to Simpang Pertang
	  Multiple falls
	  Trekking
	  Intimidating, tall waterfall

Last update October 2009
	 
	  
	  Sg. Salan FallsJerantut
	  Single fall
	  TrekkingCamping
	  A wide single drop falls with a double Olympic size pool. But NO SWIMMING.
Last update July 2011
